results.title: Stroke: the fight back
results.brief_description: Gives careful advice on how to care for stroke victims, such as encouraging daily muscle control pertaining to daily independence with the aid of a visiting nurse, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, speech therapy, medical social worker.

results.title: Stroke - a blow against life
results.creator_credit: Geoff Owen-Taylor, Australian Brain Foundation and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: The causes of stroke and its effects on the individual are discussed in detail. Also discussed are some of the support structures and rehabilitation programs nesessary for recovery. Hosted by Dan Webb.

results.title: Stripey to the rescue: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Jackie Cockle, Ellen Meske and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE, GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX, THE TREASURE HUNT, GETUP CRUSOE and KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF. STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE: Timothy’s mother decides that Stripey and Getup are old and dirty and could harm Timothy who is suffering from a cold. She gives them away to a jumble sale but on the way Getup is kidnapped by the circus and meets a mouse called Kinker. GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX: Gumpa decides that he is unwell when he wakes up one morning and his head is turned around the wrong way. His friends, Timothy and Little Mut come out in sympathy. THE TREASURE HUNT: All of the toys are hunting for treasure after Gumpa finds a mysterious plan. Getup and Stripey look in a tunnel, Little Mut is helped by a squirrel and Woeful from Jick the Jackdaw. With everyone on the case, they are sure to find something. GETUP CRUSOE: The animals are listening to Timothy reading ‘Robinson Crusoe’ but the story in interrupted when Timothy has to go to school. After he has left, Stripey has an idea, Getup has an adventure and Little Mut is very brave. KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF: When Stripey and Getup visit Mr Trig’s pet shop with Timothy they find their friend Kinker stuck in a cage. With a little help from Timothy they help him escape and find a new home for him on the animal shelf; Kinker is unhappy however, he wants to go back to his real home.

results.title: Strip mine trip
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Ben Shedd and Robert Churchill
results.brief_description: This simple film consists of a helicopter shot showing the results of strip mining with voice-overs from local mining people for and against this system of mining explaining the economical advantages versus the aesthetic and ecological disasters of it. An old man comments on all the changes that have taken place in his lifetime and mourns that strip mining is likely to be the worst.

results.title: Strip Jack naked: nighthawks 2
results.creator_credit: BFI, Channel 4, Ron Peck and Paul Hallam
results.brief_description: In 1979 English director Ron Peck released his first feature, “Nighthawks”, a low-budget exploration of the London gay club scene. Using a combination of new scenes shot on video and out-takes, loops and production notes from the original film, Peck has created a sequel which examines not only the personal struggles of a film-maker to come to an understanding of his sexuality, but also documents the struggles of young film-makers to gain funding and encouragement to create their visions on screen. Part autobiography, part film-making journal, part a history of the contemporary gay movement, “Strip Jack naked” celebrates an aesthetic and a personal sexual expression which are not represented in mainstream cinema: this film is an encouragement to any artist working from the margins.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BFI, Channel 4, Ron Peck and Paul Hallam

results.title: String sounds
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Pieter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the range of string sounds available, using different kinds of instruments, strings and ways of making strings vibrate. Demonstrates basic principles of string instruments and presents various performances. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: String quartet
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Robert Parker
results.brief_description: The Carl Pini String Quartet is seen and heard against a variety of scenic backgrounds performing the Debussy Quartet in G Minor. Also includes scenes of the Quartet at rehearsal and recording and interviews with members.

results.title: String instruments
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Children’s Concert”
At one of his concerts for Ottawa children, conductor Eugene Kash illustrates points on musical form and introduces the string instruments. When the violin, viola and cello have been presented separately, they join in a fugue, and later Mr. Kash plays a gavotte on his violin. Closing scenes are of a dance by a group of little girls, set to music composed by some of the children themselves.
